newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish Delta buys stake in N.Ireland Lorien.
newsitem.headline: Irish Delta buys stake in N.Ireland Lorien.

text.p: Irish private venture capital firm Delta Partners said on Wednesday it had bought a 27.5 percent stake in Northern Ireland software company Lorien Systems for 0.25 million Irish pounds.
"This investment is in line with our strategy of investing in fast growth companies who have developed products for the international market," Delta Partners' Maurice Roche said in a statement.
Lorien developed a software product that allows people with dyslexia and other learning difficulties correct their most common spelling mistakes.
The product is currently being sold on a licence basis to educational establishments, Delta said. It plans to release the product to the business market in January 1997.
Delta Partners has a capital fund of 23 million punts, supported by Bank of Ireland and Irish pension funds.
